Sequence Information.Peptide Name: eCATH-1 (eCATH1; natural AMPs; equine cathelicidin 1, mammals, animals; horsy; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Potently active against a broad range of bacteria E. coli ATCC 25922 or ML 35 (MIC 3 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), S. marcescens ATCC 8100 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 or SK1 (MIC 3-6 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or MRSA (MIC 25-50 ug/ml), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 6 ug/ml), S. equinus (MIC 25 ug/ml), and B. megaterium Bm11 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml).  More active than eCATH-2 and eCATH-3 in MHB.Fungi: Active against fungi various C. neoformans (MIC 6-12.5 ug/ml), R. rubra (MIC 50 ug/ml) but not C.albicans (MIC>100 ug/ml),C.parapsilosis (MIC>100 ug/ml), C.tropicalis (MIC>100 ug/ml), and P.etchellsii (MIC>100 ug/ml) in both Sabouraud medium and RPMI  (Skerlavaj B et al., 2001). It also kills Trypanozoon parasites such as T. brucei, T. evansi, and T. equiperdum (Cauchard S et al., 2016).MOA:bacteria:E. coli: membrane permeation.Structure:  helical in 30-45% TFE.In vitro toxicity: 10% human RBC 4.6% lysis at 314 ug/ml.Animal model:mouse: the equine antimicrobial peptide eCATH1 is effective against the facultative intracellular pathogen Rhodococcus equi (R. equi) in mice (Schlusselhuber M et al., 2013).Updated 7/2013; Jan2016; 10/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Scocchi M, Bontempo D, Boscolo S, Tomasinsig L, Giulotto E, Zanetti M1999
Literature Information.Title: Novel cathelicidins in horse leukocytes.
